stories.headline: Riksdag debates new housing policy ahead of spring budget
stories.summary: Parliament is set to vote on a comprehensive housing reform package that would increase funding for affordable housing construction across major Swedish cities.

stories.headline: SL announces metro line extension timeline
stories.summary: Stockholm’s public transport authority has released updated plans for the southern metro extension, with construction expected to begin in late 2026.

stories.headline: Migration agency reports decrease in asylum processing times
stories.summary: Migrationsverket has reduced average processing times by 30% following a digital transformation initiative launched last year.

stories.headline: Sweden’s inflation rate holds steady at 2.1%
stories.summary: The Riksbank’s latest figures show inflation remaining stable, with economists predicting a potential rate cut in the coming months.

stories.headline: New personnummer rules take effect for EU citizens
stories.summary: Starting March 1st, EU citizens working in Sweden will have a simplified process for obtaining a personal identity number, reducing wait times from months to weeks.
